intro: Hieracium debilipes, commonly known as the weak-stemmed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It has slender, upright stems and small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer. Hieracium debilipes is often found in moist, sandy soils and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
